document.docAuthor: Huang, Si-Yao, Volynkin, Anton V., Černý, Karel, Wang, Min & Fan, Xiao-Ling
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge on the genus Barsine Walker, 1854 from mainland China and Indochina, with description of a new species (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae, Lithosiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the knowledge on the genus Barsine Walker, 1854 from mainland China and Indochina, with description of a new species (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae, Lithosiini)

bibRefCitation.author: Moore, F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Moore, F. (1879) Description of new Genera and Species of Asiatic Lepidoptera Heterocera. Proceedings of the Scientific Meetings of the Zoological Society of London, 1879, 387 - 417, pls 32 - 34. https: // doi. org / 10.1111 / j. 1096 - 3642.1879. tb 02671. x

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Barsine pretiosa
Moore, 1879: 394
( Type locality: [N India , Himachal Pradesh ] “Dharmsala, N.W. Himalaya”).

=
Barsine pseudomactans
Volynkin & Černý 2016c: 307
, figs 7–10, 20–21, 24 ( Type locality: “[E India ] Sikkim , Phedong”), syn. nov.

Barsine pseudomactans

Volynkin ( MWM / ZSM ); Additional material
:
429 specimens of both sexes from NE Pakistan ( Punjab ), N and NE India ( Uttarakhand , Himachal Pradesh , Sikkim , north of West Bengal , Meghalaya ), Nepal , Bhutan and N Myanmar ( Kachin State ) ( NHMUK , MWM / ZSM )
.

Remarks. 1.
Barsine pseudomactans
was described based on a small amount of material having small external and genital differences from specimens originating from the same part of Himalaya as the holotype of
B. pretiosa
. Further examination of more than four hundreds additional specimens from various areas of India , Nepal , Myanmar and China displayed a rather wide range of its infraspecific variability. This fact makes obvious a conspecificity of
pseudomactans
and
pretiosa
. Thus, here we establish the new synonymy:
Barsine pretiosa Moore, 1879
=
Barsine pseudomactans Volynkin & Černý 2016
,
syn. nov.
2.
Huang et al. (2018)
wrongly identified
Barsine fangchenglaiae
sp. nov.
as
B. pseudomactans
and reported
B. pseudomactans
as a new record from China . Here we illustrate the true
B. pretiosa
from China for the first time. The external appearance of Chinese populations varies from a normal form similar to Himalayan populations ( Figs 17–18 , 23 ) to an extreme melanistic form (fig. 19), displaying a wider range of variability than Himalayan populations, but the examination of male genitalia proves they all belong to the same species. The species is also here recorded from Myanmar and Pakistan for the first time. The differences between
B. pretiosa
and
B. fangchenglaiae
sp. nov.
have already been listed in the description of the new species.

Distribution. China * (W Sichuan , NW and C Yunnan , SE Xizang ), Myanmar * ( Kachin State ), Nepal ( Volynkin & Černý, 2016c ), Bhutan ( Volynkin & Černý, 2016c ), N and NE India ( Volynkin & Černý, 2016c ), NE Pakistan * ( Punjab ).
